answerText: Ernest Rutherford[10] Rutherford's gold foil experiment made use of this device to count alphas. When alphas hit its zinc sulfide screen, it phosphoresces to make a flash visible to the human eye.
heading: SUBMIT |2014 | Editors 3 | 18 | Science | Physics | College
subject: Science
question: Question:  [10] Name this physicist whose experiments include one in which he bounced alpha particles off gold foil.
